question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_collateral_value()] [Asset Type Confusion] Can an attacker register a malicious asset that returns inflated values from dynamic_user_collateral_value() at line 102, boosting their total collateral without providing real value? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_collateral_value()] [Denial of Service] Can an attacker populate their collaterals vector with hundreds of assets, causing the while loop at lines 95-105 to consume excessive gas and DoS the health factor calculation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_collateral_value()] [Uninitialized Variable] If the while loop at lines 95-105 never executes (len=0), the function returns value=0 initialized at line 84 - can this cause users with no collateral assets to have zero health collateral, enabling improper liquidations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_collateral_value()] [Index Out of Bounds] Can vector::borrow() at line 96 panic if the collaterals vector is modified between line 82 and the loop, causing DoS for health calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Vector Manipulation] Can an attacker exploit the vector::contains() check at line 124 by having duplicate loan assets in storage, causing their debt to be counted multiple times and triggering false liquidations? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Vector Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the loans vector to exclude their actual borrowed assets, causing vector::push_back() at line 126 to add it but the existing debt not being counted, understating total loan value? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Integer Overflow] Can the value accumulation at line 141 overflow when summing multiple large loan_value amounts, wrapping to a small number and making an overleveraged attacker appear safe from liquidation? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Logic Error] Can an attacker exploit is_increase=true at line 125 to push their asset into the local loans vector 'l' at line 126, but since it's local, future calls won't see it, causing inconsistent loan value calculations across transactions? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Off-by-One] Can the len increment at line 127 cause the while loop at line 132 to read beyond the vector bounds, causing a panic or returning invalid loan data? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Zero Loan Value] If an attacker has loans but all dynamic_user_loan_value() calls at line 140 return 0 due to oracle manipulation, can they maintain unbacked positions indefinitely? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Estimate Value Manipulation] Can an attacker provide estimate_value at line 137 that only applies to one asset, allowing them to selectively understate loan value for that asset while other debts remain accurate? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Boolean Exploit] Can an attacker use is_increase=false with estimate_value>0 to cause dynamic_user_loan_value() at line 140 to subtract from their loan, potentially causing underflow and wrapping to a massive debt that locks the protocol? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Storage Race Condition] Since storage is &mut at line 112, can concurrent operations mutate the loans vector between line 118 and the loop at lines 132-143, causing inconsistent loan calculations? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Asset ID Collision] Can an attacker register multiple loans with the same asset ID, causing only one to be counted in the loop at lines 132-143, hiding their true debt? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_user_health_loan_value()] [Denial of Service] Can an attacker create hundreds of small loans across many assets, causing the while loop at lines 132-143 to consume excessive gas and DoS health factor calculations for their account?
